org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.components.modellibs.core.xtend

Class UMLFlattener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.components.modellibs.core.xtend.UMLFlattener

  • public class UMLFlattener
extends Object
    This class contains the transformation for flattening UML-RT state machines It implements the algorithms described in the technical report E. Posse. "Flattening UML-RT State Machines". Technical Report ZTR-2014-EP-001, Version 2, Zeligsoft, Sep 2014.
    Author:
    eposse

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void _phase2ProcessComplexState(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
      Replaces all entry and exit points of the composite state with junction points, and recursively apply this to sub-states.
      protected void _phase2ProcessSimpleState(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
      Removes entry and exit points of a simple state, making all transitions to and from it, direct.

      Removes entry and exit points of a simple state, making all transitions to and from it, direct.
      void annotateExplicitEntryTransitions(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
      Prepends the state's entry action to each explicit entry transition (transition from an entry point to a sub-state).
      void annotateExplicitExitTransitions(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
      Annotate explicit exit transitions (transitions from a sub-state to an exit point) with a "history saving action", an action that sets the history table entry for the composite state according to the sub-state that is exited.
      void createEntryPoints(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
      Creates entry points for every direct incoming transition (transition ending directly on the state's boundary).
      void createExitPoints(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
      Create exit points for each direct outgoing transition (transition leaving directly from the composite state's boundary).
      void createExitTransitions(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)

      Remove the initial pseudo-state and transition and create a transition from each entry point which does not have an explicit entry transition to a sub-state, to the initial state.

      Replaces the (deep)history pseudo-state with a choice point with transitions to each sub-state with conditions checking the value of the history table entry for this composite-state.

      Flattens a UML-RT state machine, removing composite states, and making explicit transitions implied by group transitions, history points and initial points.

        public UMLFlattener()

    • Method Detail

      • transform

        public org.eclipse.uml2.uml.StateMachine transform(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.StateMachine m)
        Flattens a UML-RT state machine, removing composite states, and making explicit transitions implied by group transitions, history points and initial points. This is the 'main' method of the transformer. It performs the transformation in-place.
        Parameters:
        m - a StateMachine
        Returns:
        the flat StateMachine m with all composite states, group transitions, history and initial pseudo-states removed.

        Change the names of states and transitions: prefix them with the names of the stateMachine and composite states.

      • phase1ProcessCompositeState

        public void phase1ProcessCompositeState(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
        Creates entry transitions for incoming arrows ending at the composite state's boundary or history pseudo-state. Creates exit transitions implied by group transitions.

      • annotateExplicitEntryTransitions

      • replaceHistoryPoint

        public org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Pseudostate replaceHistoryPoint(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
        Replaces the (deep)history pseudo-state with a choice point with transitions to each sub-state with conditions checking the value of the history table entry for this composite-state.

      • removeInitialTransition

        public Boolean removeInitialTransition(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state,
                                       org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Pseudostate historyChoicePoint)
        Remove the initial pseudo-state and transition and create a transition from each entry point which does not have an explicit entry transition to a sub-state, to the initial state.

      • annotateExplicitExitTransitions

        public void annotateExplicitExitTransitions(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
        Annotate explicit exit transitions (transitions from a sub-state to an exit point) with a "history saving action", an action that sets the history table entry for the composite state according to the sub-state that is exited.

      • createExitPoints

        public void createExitPoints(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
        Create exit points for each direct outgoing transition (transition leaving directly from the composite state's boundary).

      • createSaveHistoryBehavior

        public org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Behavior createSaveHistoryBehavior()

      • createExitTransitions

        public void createExitTransitions(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.State state)
        Create explicit exit transitions implied by group transitions. For each group transition creates a transition from every sub-state to the group-transitions's source exit point. It annotates these transitions with a "history saving action", an action which stores the sub-state in the history table entry for this composite state.

      • phase2

        protected org.eclipse.uml2.uml.StateMachine phase2(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.StateMachine m)
        Flatten composite states.
